 <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎סתו‎</span> [[BDB#Kt|Kt]], <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎סְתָיו‎</span> [[BDB#Qr|Qr]] **noun masculine** ==winter== (loan-word from Aramaic; compare Syriac <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">, [[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎סִיתְוָא‎</span>; Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> [[BDB#Lane|Lane]]<sup>1504</sup>; probably originally <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שׂ‎</span>, compare [[BDB#Schw|Schw]]<sup>Idioticon 64</sup>; on <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ו‎</span> as old nominative ending (<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ס‎</span> for ***šutayu***) compare [[BDB#Lag|Lag]]<sup>BN 190 Anm</sup>.); — <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הַסְּתָ֯ו עָבָ֑ר‎</span> [[Song.2.11|Song 2:11]].
